articles.author: Porfirio Ibarra and Alfredo PeÑa | AP
articles.title: US family attacked on notorious stretch of Mexican highway
articles.description: Mexican authorities continue searching for gunmen responsible for an attack on a sparsely traveled stretch of highway near the Texas border that left a 14-year-old U.S. citizen dead and four relatives wounded
articles.content: One SUV of attackers passed the family and then cut them off causing them to collide and come to a halt. Gunmen then opened fire, according to a statement from the state of Tamaulipas security coordinating group. All of the wounded came from one of the family… [+2560 chars]

articles.author: Rachael Bade
articles.title: Bolton’s willingness to testify in Trump’s impeachment trial ramps up pressure on Senate Republicans
articles.description: The former national security adviser’s surprise announcement divided the GOP, with some saying Bolton should testify and others rejecting the idea.
articles.content: Since my testimony is once again at issue, I have had to resolve the serious competing issues as best I could, based on careful consideration and study, Bolton said. I have concluded that, if the Senate issues a subpoena for my testimony, I am prepared to tes… [+7821 chars]

articles.author: Cleve R. Wootson Jr.
articles.title: Biden touts his foreign policy credentials, but faces doubts
articles.description: Joe Biden is stressing his diplomatic experience in the aftermath of an Iranian leader’s death. But rivals, and some voters, are raising questions about his record, showing the issue could cut both ways.
articles.content: Throughout a just-concluded five-day bus tour across Iowa, Biden regularly touted his tenure as chair of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee and the endorsement of former secretary of state John F. Kerry. He told voters that he had met most of the world's … [+6080 chars]

articles.author: Rachelle Krygier, Anthony Faiola
articles.title: Venezuelan opposition vows to retake National Assembly after lockout
articles.description: Venezuelan opposition led by Juan Guaidó will try to reenter the National Assembly on Tuesday after what they denounced as a “parliamentary coup.”
articles.content: The move appeared to be an attempt by Maduro to sideline Guaidó the U.S.-backed opposition leader who has unsuccessfully sought to unseat Maduro for the past year by preventing his reelection on Sunday as head of the assembly. That title has served as the bas… [+6229 chars]

articles.author: DÁnica Coto | AP
articles.title: 5.8 magnitude quake strikes Puerto Rico, damaging homes
articles.description: A 5.8 magnitude quake hit Puerto Rico before dawn, unleashing small landslides, causing power outages and collapsing some homes, as well as a famed tourist attraction
articles.content:
There were no immediate reports of casualties.
The quake was followed by a string of smaller temblors, including one measured at magnitude 5 that struck at 10:51 a.m. (1451 GMT), shaking power lines and frightening residents of southern Puerto Rico who had b… [+3821 chars]

articles.title: Trump may finally get his wish to end the Iran nuclear deal after Soleimani killing escalates tensions
articles.description: Left unclear is what President Trump will do if Tehran moves toward building a nuclear weapon.
articles.content: Amid rising threats between the United States and Iran and the possibility of a new war in the Middle East sparked by the killing of Maj. Gen. Qasem Soleimani, Iran announced Sunday that it would no longer be bound by some of the deals most important safeguar… [+6971 chars]

articles.author: Josh Dawsey
articles.title: Pompeo decides against run for U.S. Senate seat in Kansas
articles.description: The secretary of state informed Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell of his decision on Monday.
articles.content:
The two people spoke on the condition of anonymity to talk frankly about the matter.
McConnell had recruited Pompeo to run for Senate to guarantee the seat would stay in the hands of the Republican Party after the retirement of Sen. Pat Roberts.
